TITLE: United Nations Security Council demands release of Myanmar's Aung San Suu Kyi in historic resolution

TITLE: India on alert for new variants as Covid wave sweeps China
SUMMARY: India's health minister has advised the public to take precautions against Covid-19, including getting vaccinated and wearing masks, as the country remains on alert for potential new variants that could emerge from the wave of infections sweeping neighboring China.

TITLE: Big bonuses, extreme rationing: How Covid-hit China is coping with its drugs shortage
SUMMARY: The abrupt shift in China's Covid policy has left its people and health facilities ill-prepared to deal with a huge wave of infections, leading to widespread shortages of the most common drugs used to alleviate flu-like symptoms.

TITLE: Thursday flight cancellations top 1,200 nationwide, disrupting holiday travel
SUMMARY: More than 1,200 flights have been cancelled across the United States, according to the flight tracking site FlightAware, as severe winter weather threatens holiday travel.

TITLE: Washington moved fast to crack down on TikTok but has made little progress with Big Tech
SUMMARY: In a matter of days, the United States is expected to ban federal employees from downloading or using TikTok on government-issued phones or tablets, marking the country's broadest crackdown on the short-form video app to date.

TITLE: Caroline Ellison and Gary Wang plead guilty to multiple charges, are cooperating with feds
SUMMARY: Two senior executives associated with collapsed crypto exchange FTX have pleaded guilty to multiple criminal charges and are cooperating with federal prosecutors, according to unsealed court records. Additionally, the pair face civil fraud charges from the Securities and Exchange Commission that were announced Wednesday night.

TITLE: The US economy grew much faster than previously thought in the third quarter
SUMMARY: America's economy grew much faster than previously thought in the third quarter, a sign that the Federal Reserve's battle to cool the economy to fight inflation t is having only limited impact.

TITLE: NFL games are coming to YouTube TV. Google gets the rights to Sunday Ticket for 2023
SUMMARY: NFL Sunday Ticket is coming to YouTube TV, the NFL announced Thursday, following years of speculation about which media company would be next to broadcast all out-of-market NFL games to fans.

TITLE: 'I am just lost,' female Kabul student says after Taliban crackdown on women's education
SUMMARY: The 21-year-old student had been studying hard for weeks as she prepared for the final exams of her first year of university. She was almost done, with just two exams left, when she heard the news: the Taliban government was suspending university education for all female students in Afghanistan.

TITLE: NASA and Russia weigh options for astronaut return after spacecraft leak
SUMMARY: Officials at NASA and Russia's space agency, Roscosmos, are working to decide how to bring home several people at the International Space Station after a Russian Soyuz spacecraft sprang a leak last week.

TITLE: As crematoriums fill up, China shifts how it counts Covid deaths
SUMMARY: For much of the pandemic, images of overflowing hospitals and busy funeral homes from the United States have featured heavily on China's state-controlled television, where the deaths of over a million Americans from Covid is depicted as a gross failing of Western democracy.

TITLE: Japan's consumer inflation hits fresh 40-year high
SUMMARY: Japan's core consumer inflation hit a fresh four-decade high as companies continued to pass on rising costs to households, data showed, a sign price hikes were broadening and could keep the central bank under pressure to whittle down massive stimulus.

TITLE: North Korea fires short-range ballistic missiles, South Korea says
SUMMARY: North Korea launched at least one ballistic missile on Friday, according to South Korean officials, the latest in an unprecedented year of weapons testing.

TITLE: QAnon members in Japan sentenced for breaking into Covid vaccination centers
SUMMARY: Several members of a QAnon group in Japan were sentenced by a Tokyo court on Thursday for breaking into multiple Covid vaccination centers, according to CNN affiliate TV Asahi.

TITLE: UK wages next year will be at their lowest level since 2006, report says
SUMMARY: Brits hoping for a new-year salary bump to offset soaring food and energy costs may be disappointed.

TITLE: Why America's economy remains surprisingly strong -- but you don't realize it
SUMMARY: Each week brings head-scratching contradictory news about the economy. This past week was no different, with a batch of economic reports showing that — despite the recession talk — the US economy shows remarkable resilience.

TITLE: TikTok confirms that journalists' data was accessed by employees of its parent company
SUMMARY: TikTok parent company ByteDance has fired four employees who improperly accessed the personal data of two journalists on the platform, TikTok spokesperson Brooke Oberwetter confirmed to CNN Thursday.

TITLE: Companies are reining in holiday bonuses
SUMMARY: Last year, bonuses were bountiful. This year, economic uncertainty is bringing a chill to the holiday-season perk, according to survey data released Thursday by Challenger, Gray & Christmas.

TITLE: Experts: this is the best cash back card of 2022
Kremlin warns of a 'long' war after Biden offers more support on Zelensky's visit to US
SUMMARY: Kyiv and its Western allies are "set for a long confrontation with Russia" following President Volodymyr Zelensky's momentous visit to Washington, Moscow said as the war in Ukraine approaches 10 months.

TITLE: Democracy has its flaws, but it has emerged from the pandemic in much ruder health than the alternative
SUMMARY: For nearly half a decade, you could be forgiven for thinking just about everything in Western democracy seemed a bit broken. The social-media yelling in 140 characters. The wild populism, and dog-whistle racism. The clumsy coronavirus lockdowns and their attendant conspiracy theories. The tolerance of absolute, constant falsehoods. The questioning and beleaguering of the electoral process.

TITLE: US strike kills 6 al-Shabaab militants in Somalia
SUMMARY: The US carried out a strike in Somalia that killed six al-Shabaab militants on Friday, US Africa Command said in a statement.

TITLE: Police fire teargas to quell protesters at site of deadly Paris shooting
SUMMARY: • French serial killer Charles 'The Serpent' Sobhraj released from Nepali jail

SUMMARY: For nearly half a decade, you could be forgiven for thinking just about everything in Western democracy seemed a bit broken. The social-media yelling in 140 characters. The wild populism, and dog-whistle racism. The clumsy coronavirus lockdowns and their attendant conspiracy theories. The tolerance of absolute, constant falsehoods. The questioning and beleaguering of the electoral process.

TITLE: Leaked notes from Chinese health officials estimate 250 million Covid-19 infections in December: reports
SUMMARY: Almost 250 million people in China may have caught Covid-19 in the first 20 days of December, according to an internal estimate from the nation's top health officials, Bloomberg News and the Financial Times reported Friday.

TITLE: The Taliban pledged to honor women's rights in Afghanistan. Here's how it eroded them instead
SUMMARY: When the Taliban returned to power in Afghanistan in August 2021 in a lightning takeover following the withdrawal of US troops, the radical Islamist group appeared keen to distance itself from its earlier period of rule in the 1990s, presenting itself as more moderate and committed to the internal peace process.

TITLE: English cricketer Sam Curran becomes most expensive buy in Indian Premier League auction history
SUMMARY: English cricketer Sam Curran has become the most expensive auction buy in the history of the Indian Premier League (IPL) -- after being sold to the Punjab Kings for 18.5 crore rupees ($2.22 million).

TITLE: Iranian soccer player is among dozens facing execution while the West is distracted by Christmas, supporters fear
It's official: now avoid credit card interest into 2024
They were welcomed into British homes. Celebrating their first Christmas together, Ukrainians wonder if that hospitality will last
SUMMARY: Last year, Nataliia Doroshko, a 35-year-old lawyer, celebrated St. Nicholas Day with friends and family in her home city of Cherkasy, on the snowy banks of the Dnipro River, downstream from the Ukrainian capital Kyiv.

TITLE: French serial killer 'The Serpent' released from jail
SUMMARY: Charles Sobhraj, the infamous French serial killer who inspired the award-nominated TV series "The Serpent," walked free from a Nepali prison Friday.

TITLE: Taliban orders NGOs to ban female employees from coming to work
SUMMARY: The Taliban administration in Afghanistan has ordered all local and international non-governmental organizations (NGOs) to stop their female employees from coming to work, according to a letter by the Ministry of Economy sent to all licensed NGOs.

Taliban use water cannon on women protesting education order in Afghanistan
SUMMARY: A group of women took to the streets in the city of Herat in Afghanistan on Saturday, protesting against a Taliban order this week suspending all female students from attending university in the country.

TITLE: 'Life or death:' As Britons buckle under the cost of living crisis, many resort to 'warm banks' for heat this winter
SUMMARY: In a community center in central London, a young child plays in a makeshift area as her caregiver rocks her stroller and chats to a friend.

TITLE: China's top health body stops publishing daily Covid case figures as infections soar
SUMMARY: China's top health authority has announced that it has stopped publishing daily Covid-19 case numbers, as reports claimed that the true toll of the country's ongoing outbreak is much worse than the official figures published by authorities.

TITLE: Death toll from sinking of Thai navy ship rises to 18
SUMMARY: Thailand's navy said Sunday that the death toll from the sinking of one of its warships earlier in the week had risen to 18.

SUMMARY: In a community center in central London, a young child plays in a makeshift area as her caregiver rocks her stroller and chats to a friend.

TITLE: Three foreign aid groups suspend work in Afghanistan after Taliban bars female employees
SUMMARY: Three foreign aid groups said Sunday that they were moving to temporarily suspend their operations in Afghanistan after the Taliban barred female employees of non-governmental organizations from coming to work.

TITLE: Bus accident in British Columbia hospitalizes more than 50 people, officials say
SUMMARY: A bus accident in southern British Columbia, Canada, on Christmas Eve has left more than 50 people hospitalized, officials say.

TITLE: Bus accident in British Columbia hospitalizes more than 50 people
SUMMARY: A bus accident in southern British Columbia, Canada, on Christmas Eve has left more than 50 people hospitalized, officials say.

TITLE: Man accused of planting explosives before Brazil inauguration
SUMMARY: Police in Brasilia arrested a man on Saturday suspected of planting and possessing explosive devices one week ahead of former President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva's inauguration, Police Chief Robson Candido said during a news briefing.

TITLE: Three aid groups suspend work in Afghanistan
SUMMARY: Three foreign aid groups said Sunday that they were moving to temporarily suspend their operations in Afghanistan after the Taliban barred female employees of non-governmental organizations from coming to work.

TITLE: 18 of Asia's most underrated spots
SUMMARY: Comprising more than 40 countries, Asia can't be summed up easily.

TITLE: The targets of Amsterdam's 'stay away' campaign
SUMMARY: It's barely dusk on a cold Saturday afternoon in early December. But Amsterdam's Red Light District is already starting to heat up.

TITLE: Italian castle on sale for $2 million
SUMMARY: Ever dreamed of owning your own secret citadel in a beautiful region of Italy, wandering along its fortified walls like a monarch surveying their kingdom?

TITLE: The world's most expensive cities to live in
SUMMARY: It seems like every month when household bills come due, we grumble about how the cost of living has gone up again.

TITLE: Six dead in Spain after bus plunges off bridge into river
SUMMARY: Six people died and two were injured after a passenger bus careened off a bridge and plunged into an overflowing river in northwestern Spain, emergency services said on Sunday.

TITLE: Nepal's 'fierce' ex-guerrilla chief becomes new prime minister
SUMMARY: A former Maoist guerrilla who led a decade-long insurgency against Nepal's Hindu monarchy was appointed prime minister on Sunday for a third time, in alliance with the main opposition after last month's election returned a hung parliament.

TITLE: The Chinese artist outselling Van Gogh
SUMMARY: Zhang Daqian may not be a household name in the West, but in China -- and the global art market at large -- he is on par with the likes of Warhol and Monet.

TITLE: Inside Sienna Miller's charming English country cottage
SUMMARY: British actor Sienna Miller is no newcomer to the countryside. In fact, she bought her idyllic rural bolthole over a decade ago. The purchase came after Miller's big industry breaks "Alfie" (2004) and "Layer Cake" (2004); a brief but highly publicized relationship with co-star Jude Law and her subsequent anointment as one of the "It Girl"s of noughties London. "It was a time when there was a lot of press attention on me, and I wanted somewhere to escape," explained Miller, in an exclusive interview with Architectural Digest for its annual September Style issue. "I bought the house on a whim -- it offers a sanctuary. I also wanted somewhere where family and friends could gather. It has a nurturing feeling; it is a home with a heart," said the cover star.

TITLE: Celebrity stylist Law Roach on dressing Zendaya
SUMMARY: Even if you don't know Law Roach's face, you will have seen his work -- whether you've picked up a fashion magazine in recent years or populated your Instagram feed with A-listers. Think of Zendaya's 2015 Oscars outfit -- a delicate white satin Vivienne Westwood dress offset by a cascade of brunette dreadlocks, the response to which prompted a conversation on discrimination towards Black hair -- or the slate-gray, 20 foot-wide Giambattista Valli tulle dress Ariana Grande wore to the 2020 Grammys, or the vintage Bob Mackie wedding dress worn by Anya-Taylor Joy to the premiere of 'Emma' that same year. These enduring looks, to name just a few, are the work of Roach, the Chicago-born stylist who has found a knack for engineering fashion moments that cut through the noise of a typical red carpet.

TITLE: Who is the director behind Harry and Meghan's docuseries?
SUMMARY: After much speculation over the fate of Netflix's docuseries "Harry & Meghan," the first three episodes finally arrive Thursday, offering an intimate look at the lives of the Duke and Duchess of Sussex and, as the trailers suggest, further insight into why they stepped down from their royal duties.

TITLE: A Ukrainian photographer's love letter to his homeland
SUMMARY: In a drone photograph by Yevhen Samuchenko, Lake Lemuria, the so-called "Dead Sea of Ukraine," takes on a surreal, otherworldly quality. Its waters turned pink by algae, its shoreline streaked with white salt deposits, the body of water might easily be confused for an abstract painting were it not for the presence of two tiny figures and their nearby car.

TITLE: Head of major Russian shipyard dies suddenly; no cause given
SUMMARY: • Zelensky rallies Ukrainians with defiant Christmas message after deadly Russian barrage in Kherson

TITLE: Death toll from sinking of Thai navy ship rises to 18
SUMMARY: Thailand's navy said Sunday that the death toll from the sinking of one of its warships earlier in the week had risen to 18.

TITLE: Six dead in Spain after bus plunges off bridge into river
SUMMARY: Six people died and two were injured after a passenger bus careened off a bridge and plunged into an overflowing river in northwestern Spain, emergency services said on Sunday.

TITLE: Dozens of Rohingya rescued from stricken vessel after weeks adrift at sea, but fears grow for those still aboard
SUMMARY: After spending more than a month adrift on a stricken boat without food or water, dozens of starving Rohingya have been rescued in Indonesia, the United Nations refugee agency said Sunday, offering a glimmer of hope for the persecuted group who fled their refugee camps last month in search of a better life.

TITLE: China's Covid surge hits factories and consumer market
SUMMARY: China's economy is under severe strain as a wave of Covid cases sweeps across the country.

TITLE: China sends 47 aircraft across Taiwan Strait in military 'strike drill'
SUMMARY: China sent 47 aircraft across the median line of the Taiwan Strait on Sunday, its largest incursion into Taiwan's air defense zone in recent months, as Beijing steps-up efforts to normalize aggressive military operations around the self-ruled island.

TITLE: South Korea fires warning shots after North Korean drones enter its airspace
SUMMARY: Five North Korean drones crossed into South Korean airspace on Monday, prompting the South Korean military to deployed fighter jets and attack helicopters, the country's defense ministry said.

TITLE: Major foreign aid groups suspend work in Afghanistan after Taliban bars female employees
SUMMARY: Four foreign aid groups said Sunday that they were moving to temporarily suspend their operations in Afghanistan after the Taliban barred female employees of non-governmental organizations from coming to work.

TITLE: What it's like to land on the world's shortest commercial runway
SUMMARY: Flying into Saba isn't for the faint hearted. The vertiginous slopes and sea cliffs of this five-square-mile island in the Caribbean don't leave much space to land a plane. But Juancho E. Yrausquin Airport, clinging to Saba's only bit of flat land, is proof that it can be done.

TITLE: China will end Covid restrictions and quarantining for international travelers
SUMMARY: China will drop quarantine requirements for all passengers arriving from outside of the country's borders starting on January 8, 2023, its top health authority announced Monday.

TITLE: China announces Covid policy changes for international travelers
SUMMARY: China will drop quarantine requirements for all passengers arriving from outside of the country's borders starting on January 8, 2023, its top health authority announced Monday.

TITLE: North Korea's record year of missile testing is putting the world on edge
SUMMARY: In 2020, North Korea conducted four missile tests. In 2021, it doubled that number. In 2022, the isolated nation fired more missiles than any other year on record, at one point launching 23 missiles in a single day.

TITLE: Philippines reports at least 8 deaths as rains, floods disrupt Christmas celebrations
SUMMARY: Philippine authorities on Monday reported at least eight deaths mostly due to floods triggered by heavy rains in the southern provinces, as Christmas celebrations were disrupted for thousands of residents who were forced to evacuate.

TITLE: Heavy snow in Japan kills at least 17, injures dozens
SUMMARY: Heavy snowfall in northern Japan and other parts of the country killed at least 17 people and injured more than 90 others over the Christmas weekend, authorities said.

TITLE: China adds billions to its 2021 GDP estimate, but its economy is facing a big test this year
SUMMARY: China's gross domestic product (GDP) for 2021 was over half a trillion yuan more than initially calculated, official data revealed Tuesday. The update comes at a time the world's second-largest economy faces severe strain from an unprecedented wave of Covid infections sweeping the country.

TITLE: Analysis: Britain weathered political turmoil in 2022. But Brexit remains the elephant in the room
SUMMARY: The past year has been one of the most tumultuous in modern British politics. The country has gone through three prime ministers, mourned the death of its longest-serving monarch, and is currently in the midst of a cost-of-living crisis that threatens to engulf the Conservative-voting middle classes.

TITLE: Families rejoice after years of separation as China ends inbound quarantine
SUMMARY: China's partial reopening has been met with an outpouring of joy and relief from citizens -- both the hundreds of millions isolated inside the country for the past three years and those overseas separated from their loved ones.

TITLE: Oil and Turkish stocks were 2022 market winners. Russia funds and crypto tanked
SUMMARY: Oil stocks skyrocketed in 2022, so it's no surprise funds that track the energy sector were Wall Street winners this year. But the top fund of the year is a surprising one: It invests in a variety of companies based in Turkey.

TITLE: Arsène Wenger enjoys 'special' surprise return to Emirates Stadium as Arsenal beats West Ham
SUMMARY: Arsène Wenger's departure from Arsenal as the club's manager in 2018 was bittersweet.

TITLE: Novak Djokovic back in Australia following high-profile visa ban
SUMMARY: Novak Djokovic is back in Australia, according to a spokesperson with Tennis Australia, nearly a year after his high-profile visa ban from the country over his stance on the Covid-19 vaccination.

TITLE: The unforgettable cultural moments that shaped 2022
SUMMARY: If 2021 was a tentative return to in-person gatherings and social events, then 2022 felt like a more confident reinstatement of life as we knew it. The most intense years of the Covid-19 pandemic are, in many parts of the world, fading from view, though there has been no shortage of major news events to keep us on edge.

TITLE: Putin bans Russian oil exports to countries that imposed price caps, Kremlin says
SUMMARY: Russian President Vladimir Putin signed a decree on Tuesday banning oil supplies to countries that have introduced price caps on Russian oil and petroleum products, according to the decree published on the Kremlin's website -- a move that may prove to be largely symbolic.

TITLE: UN Security Council 'deeply alarmed' by Taliban restrictions on women
SUMMARY: The United Nations Security Council on Tuesday said it was "deeply alarmed" by the ruling Taliban's ban on women attending university or working for aid groups in Afghanistan.

TITLE: Fourth Japan minister exits PM Kishida's four-month-old cabinet
SUMMARY: Japanese reconstruction minister Kenya Akiba tendered his resignation on Tuesday, becoming the fourth minister to leave the cabinet appointed by Prime Minister Fumio Kishida in August.

TITLE: Irish tourist dies after falling from moving train in Thailand
SUMMARY: A 45-year-old Irish tourist died in Thailand on Tuesday after falling from a moving train, Thai police said.

TITLE: Why ethnic tensions are flaring in northern Kosovo
SUMMARY: Protesting Serbs in the ethnically divided city of Mitrovica in northern Kosovo erected new barricades on Tuesday, hours after Serbia said it had put its army on the highest combat alert following weeks of escalating tensions between Belgrade and Pristina.

TITLE: Meet the dissident Russians living the 'nightmare from which it is impossible to wake up'
SUMMARY: For Andrei Soldatov and his friends, February 24 marked the end of Russia as they knew it.

TITLE: Zero-Covid was supposed to prove China's supremacy. How did it all go so wrong for Xi?
SUMMARY: 2022 was supposed to be a triumphant year for China and its leader Xi Jinping, as he began his second decade in power with a pledge to restore the nation to greatness.
